    • Method Detail

      • newAppointmentButtonPushed

        public void newAppointmentButtonPushed​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                       java.sql.SQLException
        Method to change scenes to the new appointment page. Passes logged in user's info to next scene.
        Parameters:
        event - Parameter used to call the scene change from main window to new appointment scene.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - IOException is thrown for this event.
        java.sql.SQLException - SQLException is thrown because the initializer calls from database.

      • newCustomerButtonPushed

        public void newCustomerButtonPushed​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    java.sql.SQLException
        This method is called to change scenes from the main window to the new customer scene.
        Parameters:
        event - Event is called to help with changing scenes after loading initializer.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - This method throws an IOException.
        java.sql.SQLException - This method throws an SQLException.

      • signOutButtonPushed

        public void signOutButtonPushed​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        This method is used to sign the user out of the program.
        Parameters:
        event - Event is called to change scenes with initializer.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - This method throws an IOException

      • updateCustomerButtonPushed

        public void updateCustomerButtonPushed​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        This method is used to change scenes to update customer scene.
        Parameters:
        event - This parameter is used to help change scenes with initializer.

      • updateAppointmentButtonPushed

        public void updateAppointmentButtonPushed​(javafx.event.ActionEvent updateAppointment)
        This method is used to change scenes from main window to the update appointment window. An alert is shown if nothing is selected.
        Parameters:
        updateAppointment - Parameter used to help change scenes and call initializer.

      • deleteCustomerButtonPushed

        public void deleteCustomerButtonPushed()
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method is used to delete a customer from the database. An alert is shown if nothing is selected. Confirmation is shown before and after. If customer has appointments, alert is shown.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - This method throws an SQLException because it uses the database.

      • deleteAppointmentButtonPushed

        public void deleteAppointmentButtonPushed()
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method is used to delete an appointment from the database. Confirmations and alerts are shown.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - This method throws an SQLException because it uses the database.

      • reportButtonPushed

        public void reportButtonPushed​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               java.sql.SQLException
        This method is used to change scenes from main window to report window.
        Parameters:
        event - The event is called to help change scenes and call the initializer.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - This method throws an IOException.
        java.sql.SQLException - An SQLException is called because the initializer calls on the database.

      • initMainWindow

        public void initMainWindow​(Users user)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method is the initializer. Other scenes will call on this method when coming back to the main window. A user is passed as parameter.
        Parameters:
        user - Passed as parameter to track the user who has data to be shown and is logged in.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - SQLException is thrown because this method calls on the database.
